has been blocked by CORS policy: Response to preflight request doesn't pass access control check: No 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header is present on the requested resource.

content.text: Atlassian allows posting guest entries on their blog.
Some of the posts are not thrilling so the entry bar is not set very high, e.g.
(it is a new add-on with just dozen of active instances)
We could try to publish a guest post, i.e. "Improve your workflow and issue data accuracy" that explains:
how to use Default Values plugin or custom setup we have in Cloud for raising bugs
how to use Issue Checklist templates and post-functions to get default checklist on each transition
how to use Issue Checklist to block transition
how to use Automated Log Work to improve time logged accuracy

fields.summary: Guest blog post at https://www.atlassian.com/blog/

components.name: Data analysis
components.description: Insights into customer usage, tracking, analytics, metabase, etc.

content.text: A customer contacted us with a really neat idea of adding details to an item. See CS-225
Edit: the description below is invalid as per later discussion.
add special character to enter details in an item, e.g. {((}} (double parenthesis)
when the special characters are typed, show the popup that allows entering the item details (a popup like we have for dates or mentions)
That would require adding a popup with an input field.

Maybe we can implement it in a simpler and leaner way, i.e. just show Atlaskit black tooltip saying "Text entered within (( and )) will be displayed in a tooltip when a mouse cursor is held over the checklist item".
item details are displayed in Atlaskit Tooltip (the black one displayed quickly after hovering the element - as opposed to standard tooltip/title) when checklist item is mouse hovered.
The details are not displayed in the checklist item (only tooltip). But they are of course visible in edit mode (in the same way as we show mentions and dates)
If there are no details for an item, then standard-current tooltip (grey) is showed with "checked/unchecked" details as it is currently.
The Atlaskit Tooltip with item details displays "checked/unchecked" details too in the first line.

fields.summary: Description for an item

components.name: Data analysis
components.description: Insights into customer usage, tracking, analytics, metabase, etc.

content.text: make space for the new item (increase frame height by 5px or so)
trigger frame resize sooner (that might not solve the problem completely)
- now that we use mutation observer this is not an option - we already resize the iframe as soon as possible.

The problem is more general: the affected elements include not only items, but also popups and dropdown menu. It is solvable by rendering checklist "in the background", so that it is invisible for the user, computing the iframe's height, resizing the iframe and finally rendering the checklist as usual, but it's a lot of effort.

mentioned that Smart Checklist resizes the iframe faster and that most likely they use the "resize sensor" provided by ACE. It might be worth looking at the inner workings of the sensor - maybe we could learn something useful.

fields.summary: Newly added item is half hidden until frame resize in 0.5 a second

content.text: The problem has been reported to Atlassian support and after the investigation, they decided to raise an issue in their bug tracking system at

fields.summary: Glance (and old-style right side web-panel) displayed without content in New Issue View on Safari

content.text: The highest probability to reproduce the problem is to follow the steps:
click issue card (open New Issue View)
reload the page (New Issue View for the selected issue will open automatically)
The glance or web-panel content is displayed every time
The glance or web-panel content is intermittently displayed
